Posts.Content: Sascha - I've been advised that Black Soap (in bar format) is good to use throughout BC treatment. I got mine from waitrose but I know you're in Spain so have a google for online stockists x
Posts.Title: Questions ref radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Annie, my aches & pains kicked in on day 4 - Monday, got worse on Tuesday and were almost gone by Friday. I found my first Tax was the worst. I only used strong painkillers on the Tuesday, ibuprofen on the Monday & Wednesday & nothing on the Thurs and Fri. Top tip is to use painkillers as soon as you feel any pain at all as it will only get worse so nip itin the bud as soon as it starts. Other tip, drink loads of water. If you get a white coating on your tongue, that's oral thrush. Get Nyastatin from your GP if you notice it. GP told me pineapple juice can can rid of thrush too so get some of that in just in case. I had Del Monte pineapple ice lollies which were great as they soothed my mouth & I could actually taste them :) My honest blog post about tax is on my blog (link below) entry called Tax Truck. Love jelly x
Posts.Title: First tax tomorrow, any tips

Posts.Content: Thank you everyone for your very kind & healing words. I've started to write a blog about everything now as I feel it's kind of cathartic but also it means I can tell people without having to actually "tell" them if that makes sense. I also hope that if someone else is out there (as I'm sure sadly they are) going through the same thing as me/us and they stumble across it, it might be of some use. xx
Posts.Title: 28 & newly diagnosed

Posts.Content: Hi All, I'm 28 and newly diagnosed (22/06/12) with mixed types (Invasive Ductal & Invasive Lobular) BC. I am still completely in shock at the moment and learning how to process this. I'm currently feeling sad, scared, overwhelmed and angry all at the same time. Last Sunday I was scheduled to do Race for Life which is a 5km and as I had booked to do it months before any of this even happened I was determined to go ahead and do it still. I ran it and I raised £860 so I am really pleased that I challenged myself and completed that hurdle. I've found out that I'll be having FEC-T chemo (6 sessions every 3 weeks), surgery and then radiotheraphy follwed by 5 years on Temoxifen. I'm worried sick about the side effects of the chemo, the prognosis and so many other things. I'm due to be getting married in April 2013 and I am terrified I won't be able to one minute and then the next minute I'm using that as my determination focus. I have no idea how to "be" at the moment and keep being sick because I work myself up so much. I'm sorry if this is rambling and doesn't make sense but I think I am just totally overwhelmed by everything. I am usually such a self-controlled, organised person, I think the fact that this is so not under my control is also one of the things that is working me up the most. I am very lucky to have a fantastic partner, family and friends who have all already started rallying around me. If anyone can offer some advice as to how to deal with these initial feelings I'd be really grateful xx
Posts.Title: 28 & newly diagnosed

Posts.Content: Hi Rebecca, I was prescribed Omeprazole for heartburn and told to take it first thing in the morning so it has a chance to work throughout the day. I was also told I could start it whenever i needed it. I had the 20mg dosage to start with but I found it didn't work very well so I mentioned it to my oncologist at my meeting last week and she said that I could take 2 tablets (so 40mg) if I needed to and then to reduce it throughout the weeks back down to 1 tablet.   I also had the trouble with Senakot, not being able to go, took Senakot and then I went too much (if you get my drift!) Told onc and I've been prescribed a liquid (maybe Lactulose - not got it with me so can't check) so hopefully that'll work. My next lot is 16th August then my FEC is all done & move onto the dreaded T...   Jelly x
Posts.Title: What to drink?

Posts.Content: Hi Lisa, i had T last Friday. On Thurs my heart rate went to 165 (no previous heart probs, am only 29) & as I also had a temp of 38.2 & upset tummy I got admitted to hospital (am still here, admitted Thurs). Keep an eye on it just in case, Jelly x

Posts.Title: Suggestions for a chemo survival tool kit please!

Posts.Content: Hi Cathy, I believe that Tax is short for Taxotere which is a brand name of Docetaxel so yes there is a difference as Tax is just Docetaxel whereas TAC is the combo of the 3 drugs you mention. Love Jelly x
Posts.Title: Another TAC Question

Posts.Content: Hi All,   I am due to start the dreaded T on Friday and I am absolutely terrified :( I know there's a thread on here somewhere about T being better than FEC but I couldn't find it.   I just wondered if anyone had any tips for me? I am going to see the chemo nurses tomorrow (as the T is at a new hospital to where I had the FEC) so I wanted to know if there was anything I should be asking them. I have already bought myself pineapple ice lollies and frozen fresh pineapple sticks, some dark nail polish (I will paint them tomorrow), some nail strengthener and some cotton gloves to wear at night once I've slathered on the moisturiser.   My onc told me I would be having the jabs for 5 days after the T (blimmin scared of giving these to myself but it's better than having neutropenia I guess).   I'm so scared of all the T side effects, I did okay-ish on FEC, being constipated, having awful heartburn/indigestion, feeling nauseous & my veins hardening were the main SEs I had from FEC. Are the main ones on T losing nails, losing eyelashes & eyebrows (I still have a little bit of head hair left over despite not doing cold cap & I think my eyebrows have thinned), joint pain, drying skin & everything tasting like cardboard?   Any little (or large!) tips anyone can give me to help me deal with the Tax Truck would be really really appreciated.   Thank you from (a very frightened) Jelly xx

Posts.Title: hair :-(

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies, I hope you're all doing okay. I've had my 5th tax (Friday) & ever since other than the usual SEs I've felt really low and scared. I think maybe because I'm coming to the end of chemo there's the next scary steps to come. I'm not sure if I'm having a lumpectomy or mx yet but I guess that will be discussed when I see my onc next. I haven't seen him since chemo #2 though which worries me itself as surely they should be monitoring me throughout this while process :( After surgery I have rads which again I know nothing about other than what you've all posted on here. The other day I found a really sad blog about a girl who was the same age as me (29) & she passed away 2 weeks before she was due to get married. I know she's not me but ever since I've just had dark, low thoughts & can't seem to pick myself up. I'm really sorry for moaning as I know I could be in a much worse situation but I simply can't stop crying. I heard my OH crying in the bath this morning which broke my heart :( Any advice how to pick myself up or just a healing hug would be really appreciated. Jelly xx Sorry for lack of paragraphs, iPad doesn't like forums xx
Posts.Title: Feeling Low

Posts.Content: Thank you ladies xxx I think I might look at talking to a counsellor. Has anyone else done this & if so how do you organise? Do you go through your GP, BCN or some other way? Thank you xx
Posts.Title: Feeling Low

Posts.Title: Mel B´s "campaign"

Posts.Content: Hi Rebecca, I've started the FEC part of my treatment and I wear daily disposable contacts. I've found my eyes to be a bit drier than normal so I've bought something called Refresh Contacts (I got mine from Boots) which are 20 individual phials of contact lens solution. They're great as I can keep 1 in my handbag, 1 in my work drawer, in my car etc etc without having to carry round a big bottle of solution. When I need one I just snap the top off and use it, each one has about 10 drops worth of liquid in. The fact that they're individual phials reduces contamination and saline deposit residue too. Hope that helps, JT x

Posts.Content: Hi Amy, I'm 29, diagnosed at 28. I'm on my 5th chemo, last one next week. Have a read of my blog if you like, link below as it tells you a bit about what I've been through. Or feel free to private message me on here if there's anything you want to ask me. Jelly x
Posts.Title: chemo day 2moro

Posts.Content: Hi Judi, I found Difflam mouthwash really helped me. On the T part of my chemo, one of the nastiest side effects was that the inside of my mouth was really sore & peeled. It was truly horrible and made me feel sick as I constantly felt like there were bits of skin in my throat. I mentioned this to my chemo nurses who suggested Difflam. It works by reducing inflammation and also acts as a local anaesthetic, causing numbness and so pain relief. When my mouth peeled, I had a yucky flabby tongue and everything tasted of cardboard; the thing I found that helped more than anything was Del Monte pineapple ice lollies. Ice lollies are great because they help soothe sore mouths, and also pineapple is a natural cure for oral thrush (which I kept getting on T) so you’re getting two benefits with the one lolly. Definitely stock up on these! X
Posts.Title: Any tips for a sore tongue?

Posts.Content: Judi - this is a good Macmillan link about mouth care during chemo, might be worth a read xx http://www.macmillan.org.uk/Cancerinformation/Livingwithandaftercancer/Symptomssideeffects/Mouthcare/Chemotherapy.aspx

Posts.Title: best onc app ever

Posts.Content: Hi All, I'm due for chemo FEC #3 tomorrow, had my pre-chemo bloods yesterday & I've just been told my neutrophils are at 0.8 so they're low and the chemo might be postponed tomorrow, feel pretty depressed about it as just feel like it's impossible for me to make any plans :( and that the blimmin c is ruling my life. Is 0.8 seriously low? When do you need to be admitted to hospital or have one of those injections? I'm also supposed to be having a mammogram & biopsy on some microcalicifications today and no-one I've contacted yet can tell me if I'm still going to be going ahead with it, aaaaaahhhh! Feels like none of the departments in the same hospital are talking to each other :( Jelly x

At the moment I've found sticking it in a wine bottle chiller from the freezer (!) works best. Thank you, jelly

Posts.Title: The Film Thread

Posts.Content: I was only 28 when diagnosed & I have no babies :( My periods stopped on chemo & I still have 5 years of tamoxifen ahead of me. I hope that there will still be a chance for me to have children in the future. I find myself currently getting wretchedly jealous of my pregnant friends or random women in the street pushing prams. This b@stard c really does wreck everything :( x
